010package imagingbook.lib.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
024
025import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.DivideByZeroException;
026import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
027
028/**
029 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
030 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
031 * objects structures. 
032 * Matrices are simply two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
033 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
034 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
035 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
036 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).</p>
037 * 
038 * <p>Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) operate destructively,
039 * i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.</p>
040 * 
041 * <p>Most methods are self-explanatory and are therefore left undocumented.</p>
042 * 
043 * <p>See also {@link RealEigensolver} and implementations.</p>
044 * 
045 * @author W. Burger
046 * @version 2019/01/05
047 */
048public abstract class Matrix {
049        
050        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers. */
051        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
052        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements. */
053        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
054        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
055        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
056        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
057        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
058        
059        // ----  Vector and matrix creation -----------------------------
060
061        public static double[] createDoubleVector(int length) {
062                return new double[length];
063        }
064        
065        public static float[] createFloatVector(int length) {
066                return new float[length];
067        }
068        
069        public static double[][] createDoubleMatrix(int rows, int columns) {
070                return new double[rows][columns];
071        }
072        
073        public static float[][] createFloatMatrix(int rows, int columns) {
074                return new float[rows][columns];
075        }
076        
077        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
078        
079        /**
080         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued vector of the 
081         * specified length.
082         * @param length the length of the vector
083         * @return a vector with zero values
084         */
085        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
086                if (length < 1)
087                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
088                return new double[length];
089        }
090        
091        /**
092         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
093         * specified size.
094         * @param size the size of the matrix
095         * @return an identity matrix
096         */
097        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
098                if (size < 1)
099                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
100                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
101                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
102                        A[i][i] = 1;
103                }
104                return A;
105        }
106        
107        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
108
109        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
110                return A.length;
111        }
112        
113        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
114                return A[0].length;
115        }
116        
117        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
118                return A.length;
119        }
120        
121        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
122                return A[0].length;
123        }
124        
125        // Extract rows or columns
126        
127        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
128                return A[r].clone();
129        }
130        
131        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
132                final int rows = A.length;
133                double[] col = new double[rows];
134                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
135                        col[r] = A[r][c];
136                }
137                return col;
138        }
139        
140        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
141        
142        /**
143         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
144         * @param A a matrix
145         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
146         */
147        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
148                final int nCols = A[0].length;
149                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
150                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
151                                return false;
152                        }
153                }
154                return true;
155        }
156        
157        /**
158         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
159         * @param A a matrix
160         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
161         */
162        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
163                final int nCols = A[0].length;
164                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
165                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
166                                return false;
167                        }
168                }
169                return true;
170        }
171        
172        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
173         * and columns.
174         * @param A a matrix
175         * @return true iff the matrix is square
176         */
177        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
178                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
179        }
180        
181        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
182         * and columns.
183         * @param A a matrix
184         * @return true iff the matrix is square
185         */
186        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
187                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
188        }
189        
190        /**
191         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
192         * @param a first vector
193         * @param b second vector
194         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
195         */
196        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
197                return a.length == b.length;
198        }
199        
200        /**
201         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
202         * @param a first vector
203         * @param b second vector
204         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
205         */
206        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
207                return a.length == b.length;
208        }
209        
210        /**
211         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
212         * @param A first matrix
213         * @param B second matrix
214         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
215         */
216        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
217                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
218        }
219        
220        /**
221         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
222         * @param A first matrix
223         * @param B second matrix
224         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
225         */
226        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
227                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
228        }
229
230        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
231
232        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] A) {
233                return A.clone();
234        }
235        
236        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] A) {
237                return A.clone();
238        }
239
240        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
241                final int m = A.length;
242                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
243                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
244                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
245                }
246                return B;
247        }
248        
249        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
250                final int m = A.length;
251                float[][] B = new float[m][];
252                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
253                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
254                }
255                return B;
256        }
257        
258        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
259        
260        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] A) {
261                final int m = A.length;
262                final float[] B = new float[m];
263                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
264                        B[i] = (float) A[i];
265                }
266                return B;
267        }
268        
269        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
270                final int m = A.length;
271                final int n = A[0].length;
272                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
273                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
274                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
275                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
276                        }
277                }
278                return B;
279        }
280        
281        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] A) {
282                final int m = A.length;
283                final double[] B = new double[m];
284                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
285                        B[i] = A[i];
286                }
287                return B;
288        }
289        
290        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
291                final int m = A.length;
292                final int n = A[0].length;
293                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
294                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
295                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
296                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
297                        }
298                }
299                return B;
300        }
301        
302        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
303        
304        public static void fillD(final float[] A, float val) {
305                Arrays.fill(A, val);
306        }
307        
308        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
309                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
310                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
311                }
312        }
313        
314        public static void fillD(final double[] A, double val) {
315                Arrays.fill(A, val);
316        }
317        
318        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
319                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
320                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
321                }
322        }
323        
324        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
325        
326        // non-destructive
327        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
328                double[] c = b.clone();
329                addD(a, c);
330                return c;
331        }
332        
333        // destructive, b is modified
334        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
335                if (!sameSize(a, b))
336                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
337                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
338                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
339                }
340        }
341        
342        // non-destructive
343        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
344                float[] c = b.clone();
345                addD(a, c);
346                return c;
347        }
348        
349        // destructive, b is modified
350        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
351                if (!sameSize(a, b))
352                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
353                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
354                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
355                }
356        }
357
358        // non-destructive
359        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
360                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
361                addD(A, C);
362                return C;
363        }
364        
365        // destructive, B is modified
366        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
367                if (!sameSize(A, B))
368                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
369                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
370                        for (int j = 0; j < A[j].length; j++) {
371                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
372                        }
373                }
374        }
375        
376        // non-destructive
377        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
378                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
379                addD(A, C);
380                return C;
381        }
382        
383        // destructive, B is modified
384        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
385                if (!sameSize(A, B))
386                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
387                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
388                        for (int j = 0; j < A[j].length; j++) {
389                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
390                        }
391                }
392        }
393        
394        // ------------------------------------------------
395        
396        // non-destructive a - b
397        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
398                if (!sameSize(a, b))
399                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
400                final int n = a.length;
401                double[] c = new double[n];
402                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
403                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
404                }
405                return c;
406        }
407        
408        // non-destructive a - b
409        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
410                if (!sameSize(a, b))
411                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
412                final int n = a.length;
413                float[] c = new float[n];
414                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
415                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
416                }
417                return c;
418        }
419
420        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
421
422        // non-destructive
423        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] a) {
424                double[] b = a.clone();
425                multiplyD(s, b);
426                return b;
427        }
428        
429        // destructive
430        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] a) {
431                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
432                        a[i] = a[i] * s;
433                }
434        }
435        
436
437        // non-destructive
438        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
439                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
440                multiplyD(s, B);
441                return B;
442        }
443        
444        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
445                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
446                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
447                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
448                        }
449                }
450        }
451        
452        // non-destructive
453        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] A) {
454                float[] B = duplicate(A);
455                multiplyD(s, B);
456                return B;
457        }
458        
459        // destructive
460        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] A) {
461                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
462                        A[i] = A[i] * s;
463                }
464        }
465
466        // non-destructive
467        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
468                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
469                multiplyD(s, B);
470                return B;
471        }
472        
473        // destructive
474        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
475                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
476                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
477                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
478                        }
479                }
480        }
481        
482        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
483
484        /**
485         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A from the right, i.e., y = x * A,
486         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
487         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
488         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
489         * @return a (row) vector of length n
490         */
491        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
492                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
493                multiplyD(x, A, y);
494                return y;
495        }
496        
497        /**
498         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
499         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
500         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
501         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
502         */
503        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException {
504                if (x == y) 
505                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
506                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
507                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
508                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
509                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
510                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
511                        double s = 0;
512                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
513                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
514                        }
515                        y[i] = s;
516                }
517        }
518
519        /**
520         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
521         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
522         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
523         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
524         * @return a (column) vector of length m
525         */
526        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
527                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
528                multiplyD(A, x, y);
529                return y;
530        }
531        
532        /**
533         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
534         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
535         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
536         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
537         */
538        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
539                if (x == y) 
540                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
541                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
542                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
543                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
544                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
545                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
546                        double s = 0;
547                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
548                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
549                        }
550                        y[i] = s;
551                }
552        }
553        
554        /**
555         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
556         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
557         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
558         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
559         * @return a (column) vector of length m
560         */
561        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
562                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
563                multiplyD(A, x, y);
564                return y;
565        }
566        
567        /**
568         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
569         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
570         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
571         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
572         */
573        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
574                if (x == y) 
575                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
576                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
577                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
578                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
579                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
580                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
581                        double s = 0;
582                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
583                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
584                        }
585                        y[i] = (float) s;
586                }
587        }
588        
589
590        
591        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
592        
593        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
594        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
595                int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
596                int q = getNumberOfColumns(B);
597                double[][] C = createDoubleMatrix(m, q);
598                multiplyD(A, B, C);
599                return C;
600        }
601        
602        // A * B -> C (destructive)
603        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
604                if (A == C || B == C) 
605                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
606                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
607                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
608                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
609                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
610                if (nA != mB)
611                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
612                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
613                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
614                                double s = 0;
615                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
616                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
617                                }
618                                C[i][j] = s;
619                        }
620                }
621        }
622        
623        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
624        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
625                // TODO: also check nA = mB
626                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
627                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
628                float[][] C = createFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
629                multiplyD(A, B, C);
630                return C;
631        }
632
633        // A * B -> C (destructive)
634        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
635                if (A == C || B == C) 
636                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
637                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
638                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
639                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
640                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
641                if (nA != mB)
642                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
643                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
644                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
645                                float s = 0;
646                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
647                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
648                                }
649                                C[i][j] = s;
650                        }
651                }
652        }
653        
654        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
655        
656        /**
657         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
658         * which must have the same length.
659         * @param x first vector
660         * @param y second vector
661         * @return the dot product
662         */
663        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
664                if (!sameSize(x, y))
665                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
666                double sum = 0;
667                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
668                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
669                }
670                return sum;
671        }
672        
673        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
674        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
675        /**
676         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
677         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
678         * m is the length of the second vector.
679         * @param x first vector (of length m)
680         * @param y second vector (of length n)
681         * @return the outer product (matrix)
682         */
683        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
684                final int m = x.length;
685                final int n = y.length;
686                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
687                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
688                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
689                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
690                        }
691                }
692                return M;
693        }
694
695        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
696
697        /**
698         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
699         * @param x a vector
700         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
701         */
702        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
703                double sum = 0;
704                for (double val : x) {
705                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
706                }
707                return sum;
708        }
709
710        /**
711         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
712         * @param x a vector
713         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
714         */
715        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
716                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
717        }
718
719        /**
720         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
721         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
722         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
723         * @param x a vector
724         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
725         */
726        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
727                double sum = 0;
728                for (double val : x) {
729                        sum = sum + (val * val);
730                }
731                return sum;
732        }
733        
734        /**
735         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
736         * @param x a vector
737         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
738         */
739        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
740                double sum = 0;
741                for (double val : x) {
742                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
743                }
744                return (float) sum;
745        }
746
747        /**
748         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
749         * @param x a vector
750         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
751         */
752        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
753                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
754        }
755
756        /**
757         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
758         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
759         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
760         * @param x a vector
761         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
762         */
763        public static float normL2squared(final float[] x) {
764                double sum = 0;
765                for (double val : x) {
766                        sum = sum + (val * val);
767                }
768                return (float) sum;
769        }
770        
771        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
772        
773        /** 
774         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
775         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
776         * number of elements.
777         * @param x first vector
778         * @param y second vector
779         * @return the distance
780         */
781        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
782                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
783        }
784        
785        /** 
786         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
787         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
788         * number of elements.
789         * @param x first vector
790         * @param y second vector
791         * @return the squared distance
792         */
793        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
794                double sum = 0;
795                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
796                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
797                }
798                return sum;
799        }
800        
801        /** 
802         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
803         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
804         * number of elements.
805         * @param x first vector
806         * @param y second vector
807         * @return the distance
808         */
809        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
810                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
811        }
812        
813        /** 
814         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
815         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
816         * number of elements.
817         * @param x first vector
818         * @param y second vector
819         * @return the squared distance
820         */
821        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
822                double sum = 0;
823                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
824                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
825                }
826                return (float) sum;
827        }
828        
829        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
830        
831        /**
832         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
833         * @param A a matrix
834         * @return the norm of the matrix
835         */
836        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
837                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
838                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
839                double s = 0;
840                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
841                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
842                                s = s + A[i][j] * A[i][j];
843                        }
844                }
845                return Math.sqrt(s);
846        }
847
848        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
849
850        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
851                double sum = 0;
852                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
853                        sum = sum + x[i];
854                }
855                return sum;
856        }
857        
858        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
859                double sum = 0;
860                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
861                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
862                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
863                        }
864                }
865                return sum;
866        }
867        
868        public static float sum(final float[] x) {
869                double sum = 0;
870                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
871                        sum = sum + x[i];
872                }
873                return (float) sum;
874        }
875        
876        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
877                double sum = 0;
878                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
879                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
880                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
881                        }
882                }
883                return sum;
884        }

886        // --------------------------------------------------

888        /**
889         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
890         * @param A a matrix
891         * @param row the row index
892         * @return the sum of the row's elements
893         */
894        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
895                return sum(A[row]);
896        }
897        
898        /**
899         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
900         * @param A a matrix
901         * @param row the row index
902         * @return the sum of the row's elements
903         */
904        public static float sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
905                return sum(A[row]);
906        }
907        
908
909        /**
910         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
911         * @param A a matrix
912         * @param col the column index
913         * @return the sum of the column's elements
914         */
915        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
916                double sum = 0;
917                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
918                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
919                }
920                return sum;
921        }
922        
923        /**
924         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
925         * @param A a matrix
926         * @param col the column index
927         * @return the sum of the column's elements
928         */
929        public static float sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
930                double sum = 0;
931                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
932                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
933                }
934                return (float) sum;
935        }
936        
937        /**
938         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
939         * them as a vector with one element per row.
940         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
941         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
942         */
943        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
944                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
945                for (int r = 0; r < sumVec.length; r++) {
946                        double sum = 0;
947                        for (int c = 0; c < A[r].length; c++) {
948                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
949                        }
950                        sumVec[r] = sum;
951                }
952                return sumVec;
953        }
954        
955        /**
956         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
957         * them as a vector with one element per row.
958         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
959         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
960         */
961        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
962                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
963                for (int r = 0; r < sumVec.length; r++) {
964                        double sum = 0;
965                        for (int c = 0; c < A[r].length; c++) {
966                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
967                        }
968                        sumVec[r] = (float) sum;
969                }
970                return sumVec;
971        }
972        
973        /**
974         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
975         * them as a vector with one element per column.
976         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
977         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
978         */
979        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
980                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
981                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
982                        double sum = 0;
983                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
984                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
985                        }
986                        sumVec[c] = sum;
987                }
988                return sumVec;
989        }
990        
991        /**
992         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
993         * them as a vector with one element per column.
994         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
995         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
996         */
997        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
998                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
999                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1000                        double sum = 0;
1001                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1002                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1003                        }
1004                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1005                }
1006                return sumVec;
1007        }
1008        
1009        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1010        
1011        public static float min(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1012                if (x.length == 0)
1013                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1014                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1015                for (float val : x) {
1016                        if (val < minval) {
1017                                minval = val;
1018                        }
1019                }
1020                return minval;
1021        }
1022        
1023        public static double min(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1024                if (x.length == 0)
1025                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1026                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1027                for (double val : x) {
1028                        if (val < minval) {
1029                                minval = val;
1030                        }
1031                }
1032                return minval;
1033        }
1034        
1035        public static float max(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1036                if (x.length == 0)
1037                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1038                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1039                for (float val : x) {
1040                        if (val > maxval) {
1041                                maxval = val;
1042                        }
1043                }
1044                return maxval;
1045        }
1046        
1047        public static double max(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1048                if (x.length == 0)
1049                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1050                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1051                for (double val : x) {
1052                        if (val > maxval) {
1053                                maxval = val;
1054                        }
1055                }
1056                return maxval;
1057        }
1058        
1059        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1060                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1061                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1062                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1063                                if (val > maxval) {
1064                                        maxval = val;
1065                                }
1066                        }
1067                }
1068                return maxval;
1069        }
1070        
1071        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1072                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1073                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1074                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1075                                if (val > maxval) {
1076                                        maxval = val;
1077                                }
1078                        }
1079                }
1080                return maxval;
1081        }
1082        
1083        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1084        
1085        /**
1086         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1087         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1088         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1089         */
1090        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
1091                int n = 0;
1092                for (float[] x : xs) {
1093                        n = n + x.length;
1094                }
1095                float[] va = new float[n];
1096                int j = 0;
1097                for (float[] x : xs) {
1098                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1099                                va[j] = x[i];
1100                                j++;
1101                        }
1102                }               
1103                return va;
1104        }
1105
1106        /**
1107         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1108         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1109         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1110         */
1111        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
1112                int n = 0;
1113                for (double[] x : xs) {
1114                        n = n + x.length;
1115                }
1116                double[] va = new double[n];    
1117                int j = 0;
1118                for (double[] x : xs) {
1119                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1120                                va[j] = x[i];
1121                                j++;
1122                        }
1123                }               
1124                return va;
1125        }
1126        
1127        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
1128        
1129        /**
1130         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1131         * which must have the same length.
1132         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1133         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1134         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1135         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1136         * @return the interpolated vector
1137         */
1138        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
1139                float[] c = new float[a.length];
1140                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1141                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1142                }
1143                return c;
1144        }
1145        
1146        /**
1147         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1148         * which must have the same length.
1149         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1150         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1151         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1152         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1153         * @return the interpolated vector
1154         */
1155        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
1156                double[] c = new double[a.length];
1157                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1158                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1159                }
1160                return c;
1161        }
1162        
1163        
1164        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
1165        
1166        /**
1167         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
1168         * vector, which contains an additional 1-element.
1169         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
1170         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
1171         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
1172         */
1173        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
1174                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
1175                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
1176                        xh[i] = xc[i];
1177                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
1178                }
1179                return xh;
1180        }
1181        
1182        /**
1183         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
1184         * vector, which is one element shorter.
1185         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
1186         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
1187         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
1188         */
1189        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
1190                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
1191                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
1192                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
1193                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
1194                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
1195                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
1196                }
1197                return xc;
1198        }
1199        
1200        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
1201        
1202        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1203                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1204                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1205                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1206        }
1207        
1208        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1209                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1210                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1211                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1212        }
1213        
1214        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1215                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1216                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1217                return
1218                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
1219                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
1220                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
1221                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
1222                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
1223                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1224        }
1225
1226        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1227                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1228                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1229                return 
1230                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
1231                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
1232                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
1233                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
1234                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
1235                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1236        }
1237        
1238        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1239                if (!isSquare(A))
1240                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1241                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1242                return new LUDecomposition(M).getDeterminant();
1243        }
1244        
1245        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
1246        
1247        public static double trace(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1248                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1249                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1250                if (m != n) 
1251                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1252                double s = 0;
1253                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1254                                s = s + A[i][i];
1255                }
1256                return s;
1257        }
1258        
1259        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
1260        
1261        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
1262                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1263                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1264                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
1265                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1266                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1267                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1268                        }
1269                }
1270                return At;
1271        }
1272        
1273        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
1274                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1275                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1276                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
1277                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1278                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1279                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1280                        }
1281                }
1282                return At;
1283        }
1284        
1285        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
1286        
1287        /**
1288         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1289         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
1290         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1291         * @param A a square matrix
1292         * @return the inverse matrix
1293         */
1294        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1295                if (!isSquare(A))
1296                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1297                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1298                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
1299        }
1300        
1301        /**
1302         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1303         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1304         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1305         * @param A a square matrix
1306         * @return the inverse matrix
1307         */
1308        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1309                if (!isSquare(A))
1310                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1311                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
1312                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
1313        }
1314
1315        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1316        
1317        /**
1318         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
1319         * A * x = b. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1320         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1321         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1322         * @param b a vector of length n
1323         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n
1324         */
1325        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
1326                RealMatrix AA = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1327                RealVector bb = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b);
1328                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(AA).getSolver();
1329//              double[] x = null;
1330//              try {
1331//                      x = solver.solve(bb).toArray();
1332//              } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
1333                return solver.solve(bb).toArray();
1334        }
1335        
1336        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
1337        
1338        public static String toString(double[] x) {
1339                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1340                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1341                printToStream(x, strm);
1342                return bas.toString();
1343        }
1344        
1345        public static String toString(float[] x) {
1346                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1347                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1348                printToStream(x, strm);
1349                return bas.toString();
1350        }
1351        
1352        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
1353                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1354                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1355                printToStream(A, strm);
1356                return bas.toString();
1357        }
1358        
1359        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
1360                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1361                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1362                printToStream(A, strm);
1363                return bas.toString();
1364        }
1365        
1366        // --------------------
1367        
1368        public static void printToStream(double[] x, PrintStream strm) {
1369                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1370                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1371                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1372                        if (i > 0)
1373                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1374                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, x[i]);
1375                }
1376                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1377                strm.flush();
1378        }
1379        
1380        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1381                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1382                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1383                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1384                        if (i == 0)
1385                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1386                        else
1387                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1388                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
1389                                if (j == 0) 
1390                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1391                                else
1392                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1393                        }
1394                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1395                }
1396                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1397                strm.flush();
1398        }
1399        
1400        public static void printToStream(float[] A, PrintStream strm) {
1401                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1402                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1403                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1404                        if (i > 0)
1405                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1406                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i]);
1407                }
1408                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1409                strm.flush();
1410        }
1411        
1412        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1413                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1414                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1415                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1416                        if (i == 0)
1417                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1418                        else
1419                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1420                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1421                                if (j == 0) 
1422                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1423                                else
1424                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1425                        }
1426                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1427                }
1428                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1429                strm.flush();
1430        }
1431
1432        // Exceptions ---------------------
1433        
1434        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
1435                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1436                
1437                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
1438                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
1439                }
1440        }
1441        
1442        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
1443                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1444                
1445                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
1446                        super("square matrix expected");
1447                }
1448        }
1449        
1450        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
1451                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1452                
1453                public SameSourceTargetException() {
1454                        super("source and target must not be the same");
1455                }
1456        }
1457        
1458        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
1459                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1460                
1461                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
1462                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
1463                }
1464        }
